nodes.documentation:
@title Extend this rule in order to restrict relayers of a meta-transaction.
 * @notice If you want to restrict the relayers that can relay meta-transactions
        to your rule, you can extend this contract with your rule. Your rule
        has to include the modifier `firewalled` for all functions that
        should be restricted.
        The firewall can be disabled, but not enabled again. When it is
        disabled, the modifier basically does nothing anymore.
nodes.name: FirewalledRule

nodes.documentation:
Emitted when the firewall gets disabled.
It is the only event, because a firewall cannot get re-enabled.
nodes.name: FirewallDisabled

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "This method is firewalled. Transaction must originate from an organization worker."

arguments.value: This method is firewalled. Transaction must originate from an organization worker.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "This method is firewalled. Transaction must originate from an organization worker."

nodes.documentation:
Requires that `tx.origin` is an organization worker, if the firewall is
enabled. Once the firewall has been disabled, this modifier will not
enforce any checks anymore.
The modifier checks `tx.origin` and not `msg.sender`, because
`msg.sender` can be another contract. However, what the firewall is
supposed to check is who relayed the meta-transaction. The relayer is
always `tx.origin`.
nodes.name: firewalled

nodes.documentation: @param _organization The address of an organization contract.

@notice Disables the firewall so that anyone can use firewalled methods.
        Disabling the firewall cannot be done undone. There is no method
        to enable the firewall again.
        Emits a `FirewallDisabled` event.
nodes.name: disableFirewall

devdoc.title: Extend this rule in order to restrict relayers of a meta-transaction.

disableFirewall().notice: Disables the firewall so that anyone can use firewalled methods.        Disabling the firewall cannot be done undone. There is no method        to enable the firewall again.        Emits a `FirewallDisabled` event.

userdoc.notice: If you want to restrict the relayers that can relay meta-transactions        to your rule, you can extend this contract with your rule. Your rule        has to include the modifier `firewalled` for all functions that        should be restricted.        The firewall can be disabled, but not enabled again. When it is        disabled, the modifier basically does nothing anymore.
